item.title: Dipole Antenna for Shortwave Listening
item.description: I’m pretty notorious for jumping around between hobbies. I’ll normally stick to one for a few months and then drop it, only to circle back around to it a few years later. One hobby I’ve always been fascinated with but never actually got stuck into is amateur radio. At the moment I’m gearing up towards getting my General Amateur Operatorâ€™s Certificate of Competency so I can get on the air (I’ve had some pretty amazing help from the Christchurch branch of the NZART and I’m hoping to achieve that goal in the next few weeks).

item.title: External Link: NZ Amateur Radio License Anki Deck
item.description: This is an Anki deck I made for memorising everything you need to know to pass the NZ Amateur Radio license test. The questions/answers were all pulled from the public-domain list that is maintained on the NZART page. You can download the deck from the AnkiWeb page.

item.title: About Me
item.description: I’m a Software Engineer based in Christchurch, New Zealand. While I have a lot of experience with both backend and frontend engineering, my expertise these days is mostly focused around data engineering. I work with big data on a daily basis in my current role. Some things I know a bit about in no particular order: Linux Java Python Kotlin Scala Apache Druid Apache Kafka Hadoop Apache Spark Docker Amazon Web Services SQL Typescript Angular CSS Bash Avro Scrum Kanban Avro Feel free to get in touch with me at dave@cloventt.
